Description: Scarab in glazed composition, probably mould-made; underside decorated with schematic figure of a standing man holding a stick in his right hand.
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Petrie (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVIII, no. 125). The motif depicted on the base appears on some scarabs produced at Naukratis (on the various productions of the “Scarab Factory”, see Webb forthcoming). This scarab belongs to a type which was widely distributed in the Mediterranean area and Southern Russia (Gorton 1996, 93, 98-99, type XXVIII A, subtype A214-219). Petrie illustrated some examples from Naukratis displaying this motif (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVII, 123-125). It can be found on glazed composition and Egyptian blue scarabs and scaraboids: BM 1886,0401.1677; Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 88.869; Paris, Louvre Museum E8056 bis.14; Sydney, The Nicholson Museum, University of Sydney NM00.128.9. Gorton, A.F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Webb, V. forthcoming, Faience finds from Naukratis and their implications for the chronology of the site, in R. Thomas (ed.), forthcoming. Naukratis in Context I: The Nile Delta as a Landscape of Connectivity. Proceedings of the First Naukratis Project Workshop held at The British Museum 16th – 17th December 2011.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVII, no. 125)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.075) (phase 3)
